prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal, and the height is half the width. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles based on the "coordinate\\_system" information: * euler\\_angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] Set the translation vector based on the "coordinate\\_system" information: * translation\\_vector: [0.0, 0.007, 0.0502] Next, draw the 2D sketch according to the "sketch" information: * Draw a rectangle using lines on the X and Y axes (face\\_1, loop\\_1). * References for the points (use your CAD software to determine the correct values): | Line | Start Point | End Point | |||| | line\\_1 | [0.0, 0.0] | [0.4666, 0.0] | | line\\_2 | [0.4666, 0.0] | [0.4666, 0.6998] | | line\\_3 | [0.4666, 0.6998] | [0.0, 0.6998] | | line\\_4 | [0.0, 0.6998] | [0.0, 0.0] | Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter under "extrusion": * sketch\\_scale: 0.6998 Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal (Z axis) to generate the 3D model with the following parameters: * extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.0035 This concludes the creation of the intermediate part. The dimensions are provided in the "description" as the length (0.6998), width (0.0035), and height (0.6998). Please note that these instructions are strictly based on the provided JSON and should be adjusted depending on your specific CAD software and design requirements.</description>

Draw a line from (0.3125, 0.25) to (0.125, 0.25). 5. Draw an arc from (0.125, 0.25) to (0.125, 0.0) with a midpoint at (0.0, 0.125). prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Sloped Side Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 1 unit in height. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle. 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0862, 0.1884] 2. For the sketch, draw a 2D shape on the XY plane of the newly created coordinate system. This 2D shape will be later extruded into a 3D model. 2.1. Create a rectangle by drawing the following lines on the XY plane: - Line 1: Starting from (0.0, 0.0), ending at (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Starting from (0.75, 0.0), ending at (0.75, 0.3399) - Line 3: Starting from (0.75, 0.3399), ending at (0.0, 0.3399) - Line 4: Starting from (0.0, 0.3399), ending at (0.0, 0.0) 3. Scale the 2D shape by a factor of 0.75 using the `sketch_scale` parameter. 4. Transform the 2D shape into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system rotation as specified (euler angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) and the translation vector [0.0, 0.0862, 0.1884]. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch with the following parameters: - Extrusion depth towards normal: 0.2064 - Extrusion depth opposite normal: 0.0 - This results in creating a new solid body for the three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side equating to the description provided. The sloped side's top edge is at a height of 0.2064 units, with a 45 degree angle from the bottom edge. The resulting prism has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 units (1 unit x 0.75) - Width: 0.75 units (1 unit x 0.75) - Height: 0.2064 units (0.1884 units from translation vector + 0.018 units extrusion depth)</description>
